revised_title: Interface Effects on Crack Propagation in Composites
tldr: This article presents a novel theory on how a crack can be accelerated or retarded when it meets an interface between two equally brittle materials of different elastic properties. The author conducts experiments on a model crack system, which demonstrates that the toughness of a composite material with periodic stiffness changes along the crack path can be significantly greater than the toughness of its individual components. The findings have implications for designing tough composite structures.
